title: Q1 Checkpoint: Foundations, Angles & Triangles
description: Cumulative assessment covering geometric foundations, angle relationships, parallel lines with transversals, triangle classification, angle sum theorem, exterior angle theorem, and triangle inequality.

assessmentProblems.question: Name three collinear points from the figure: Points A, B, and C lie on line m. Point D is not on line m.
Two angles are supplementary. One measures (3x + 15)° and the other measures (2x + 40)°. Find x.
Two parallel lines are cut by a transversal. An alternate interior angle pair measures (5x - 10)° and (3x + 14)°. Find x.
A triangle has two congruent sides and one angle measuring 90°. Classify it using dual classification.
In triangle PQR, angle P = 58° and angle Q = 47°. Find angle R.
An exterior angle of a triangle measures 125°. One remote interior angle is 65°. Find the other remote interior angle.
Can sides of length 4, 6, and 11 form a triangle? Explain.
Two parallel lines are cut by a transversal. Same-side interior angles measure (4x + 5)° and (6x - 15)°. Find x and both angle measures.
The angles of a triangle are (3x)°, (5x - 20)°, and (2x + 10)°. Find all three angle measures and classify the triangle.
